meanings.definition: An assembly of the wise men in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: The witenagemot gathered to discuss important matters in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The witenagemot met regularly to advise the king on various issues.
meanings.sent3: The witenagemot had a lively debate about the best way to protect the village.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the witenagemot was portrayed as the ultimate source of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The image of the witenagemot sitting in a circle, deep in thought, stuck in the children's minds.

meanings.definition: A council or assembly of nobles and high officials in medieval England.
meanings.sent1: The witenagemot was called to address the concerns of the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: During the witenagemot, the nobles discussed strategies for the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent3: At the witenagemot, the nobles couldn't agree on the best course of action.
meanings.sent4: The witenagemot stood as a symbol of unity among the ruling class.
meanings.sent5: The grand hall echoed with the voices of the witenagemot as they deliberated on the new law.
